articles.title: Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Completed Pyongyang Baby Home, Orphanage
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Completed Pyongyang Baby Home, Orphanage
Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), first chairman of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), gave field guidance to the completed Pyongyang Baby Home and Orphanage.
					 He was greeted on the spot by Army Lieut. General Ma Won Chun, director of the Designing Department of the NDC, Ro Kyong Jun, Kim Jin Gun and other commanding officers of the construction unit and officials of the baby home and orphanage.
					
					 They have more than 250 rooms including nursing rooms, education rooms, physical exercise rooms, intelligence games rooms and the treatment rooms. They are equipped with facilities and fixtures, outdoor and indoor wadding pools, parks and various amusement facilities and apparatuses for the children.
					
					 Enjoying a bird's-eye-view of the baby home and orphanage with a broad smile, he expressed great satisfaction with their construction, saying they look very nice, the longer one watches them, the more splendid and fascinating they look and they are icons in the era of Songun.
					
					 He went round different places to learn about in detail about their completion.
					
					  Saying that every place of the baby home and orphanage provides good conditions for living and upbringing and education of the children, he noted that providing these facilities is important but what is more important is to bring them up well. He gave precious instructions for increasing the responsibility and role of the nurses and teachers.
					
					 He praised the soldier-builders for successfully building the baby home and orphanage as intended by the party, adding they are a distinguished unit for the construction in the country. He extended again thanks of the KPA supreme commander to KPA Unit 267 which has built a lot of monumental structures this year, ushering a heyday of construction in the era of Songun.
					
					 He was accompanied by Secretaries of the Central Committee of the WPK Choe Ryong Hae and Kim Ki Nam, Han Kwang Sang, department director of the C.C., the WPK, and Ri Jae Il, first vice-department director of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kye Hun Gyong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kye Hun Gyong
Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un on October 26 sent a wreath to the bier of People's Artiste Kye Hun Gyong, composer of the State Merited Chorus, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sojourns in Sudan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sojourns in Sudan
Khartoum, October 25 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on an official goodwill visit to Sudan made a congratulatory speech at the closing ceremony of the 4th Congress of the Sudanese National Congress Saturday.
					 He congratulated Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir upon his reelection as chairman of the Sudanese National Congress and the successful congress.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two parties and two peoples with a long history and tradition would continue developing on good terms, wishing the Sudanese people big successes in their work for the prosperity of the country under the leadership of the Sudanese National Congress.
					
					 Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir asked Kim Yong Nam once again to convey his heartfelt regards to Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 On the same day, Kim Yong Nam and his party visited the Schoolchildren's Palace in Khartoum.
					
					 Meanwhile, inter-sector talks between the DPRK and Sudan took place and an agreement on the cooperation in the field of public health and traditional medicine between the governments of the DPRK and Sudan was signed.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Austria
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Austria
Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Heinz Fischer, president of Austria, on its national day.
					 The message expressed the belief that the relations between the two countries would continue developing on good terms and wished friendly Austria prosperity.

articles.title: Delegation of Ministry of Railways Back Home
articles.content:
Delegation of Ministry of Railways Back Home
Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Ministry of Railways led by Minister Jon Kil Su returned home Sunday after taking part in an international seminar held in Sochi, Russia.

articles.title: Autumn Land Management Makes Headway in DPRK
articles.content:
Autumn Land Management Makes Headway in DPRK
Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Officials and other people across the country are working hard to give face-lifting to the mountains and streams.
					 Achievements were made in Pyongyang to repair hundreds of bridges and arrange surroundings.
					
					 South Phyongan Province is pushing forward the project for paving the road extending tens of kilometers from Sinyang County to Hoechang County and making innovations in laying earth and sand on banks of rivers and streams.
					
					 Sunchon City finished the embankment project of the River Taedong while ensuring quality and successfully finished the building of parks and sewage treatment plants.
					
					 South and North Hwanghae provinces are successfully carrying out the autumn land management.
					
					 Signal successes were reported from Haeju City and Yonthan County.
					
					 Cities and counties of North Phyongan and North and South Hamgyong provinces are channeling their efforts into repairing and managing roads.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Leaflet-Scattering Operation Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Leaflet-Scattering Operation Protested in S. Korea
Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- South Koreans from all walks of life are strongly protesting against the anti-DPRK leaflet-scattering operation by conservative organizations, according to MBC, KBS and CBS of south Korea.
					 The Kumgangsan Council of Businessmen in an appeal on Friday denounced the operation as an act of chilling the atmosphere of improving inter-Korean relations, urging the "government" to stop the operation for the safety of the people and improvement of the south-north ties.
					
					 120 civic organizations called for foiling the leaflet-scattering operation for the safety of south Koreans, declaring the local residents would join in the sit-in on Oct. 25.
					
					 The inhabitants in the area around Rimjin Pavilion in Phaju, Kyonggi Province staged a sit-in from Oct. 23 to 25 to deter conservative organizations from scattering leaflets.
					
					 The puppet police checked the struggle of the members of progressive organizations.

articles.title: S. Korean Papers Condemn Regime for Conniving at Leaflet-scattering Operations
articles.content:
S. Korean Papers Condemn Regime for Conniving at Leaflet-scattering Operations
Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore in an editorial on Oct. 25 lashed out at the south Korean puppet regime for conniving at the anti-DPRK leaflet-scattering operations of the conservative bodies.
					 The editorial said that the anti-DPRK leaflet-scattering operations of the conservative bodies were not just a "balloon game" but an extremely dangerous war gamble.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 In particular, it is all the more imperative for the inhabitants in the areas of Phaju and Ryonchon, Kyonggi Province where such operations are planned, to stop these reckless operations.
					
					 Such operations can be prevented in advance by invoking law.
					
					 A civic body recently attempted to fly a balloon of leaflets calling for instituting a special law on the ferry Sewol in an area near Kwanghwamun in Seoul only to be stopped for the mere reason that the area is a no-fly zone.
					
					 This does not mean that there is no legal ground to check such an operation as claimed by the regime but it is a proof that the regime is not willing to stop the leaflet-scattering operations of the conservative bodies.
					
					 If there exists even one percent of the danger of war, it is the duty of the regime to prevent it in advance.
					
					 On the same day the south Korean paper Hankuk Ilbo in an editorial said that the operations will only cause conflict with the north and contradiction with local inhabitants. The "government" should defuse military tension and protect life and properties of the people, it added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Poland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Poland
Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- A Polish committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in Warsaw on Oct. 20.
					 Slaboy January Guzowski, chairman of the Central Committee of the Poland-Korea Association, was elected chairman of the memorial committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize a remembrance meeting, seminar on exploits of Kim Jong Il and other political and cultural events on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: WPK Founding Anniversary Marked in Various Countries
articles.content:
WPK Founding Anniversary Marked in Various Countries
Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries on the occasion of the 69th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 A meeting and book and photo exhibition were held in Pakistan, lectures in DR Congo and Guinea and a film show in Cambodia from Oct. 7 to 10.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos dealing with the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were their works and books and photos introducing the true picture of the WPK.
					
					 The general secretary of the Sind State Committee of the Pakistan Awami National Party said the invincible might and dignity of the WPK would have been unthinkable without the leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and that the WPK being led by Kim Jong Un would demonstrate its honor as the greater and glorious party and the Korean people would certainly achieve the cause of building a thriving nation.
					
					 The chairman of the Association for Implementing the Juche Philosophy of DR Congo stressed that the WPK founded by the President and developed by Kim Jong Il had traversed only the path of victory in the whole period of the revolutionary struggle.
					
					 The editor-in-chief of the Cambodian Newspaper Pracheachon said the WPK founded by the President is the powerful political force leading the Korean people to victory and prosperity and that Kim Jong Il had developed the WPK into the invincible party whose members are united firm around the leader.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event held in Pakistan.

articles.title: Seminars on DPRK's Human Rights Policy Held in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Seminars on DPRK's Human Rights Policy Held in Bangladesh
Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Seminars on the DPRK's human rights policy were held by the Bangladesh Communist Party and the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy on Oct. 14 and 21.
					 Present there were officials and members of the Bangladesh Communist Party, Socialist Party of Bangladesh and the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Bangladesh Communist Party and M. Jahangir Khan, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, explained the DPRK's human rights policy at the seminar.
					
					 Speeches followed them.
					
					 The speakers referred to the fact that in the DPRK the people enjoy genuine political freedom and rights as well as social and cultural rights as the master of the state and society.
					
					 They said that the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK is the biggest obstacle dampening the ardent desire of the Korean people for genuine human rights.
					
					 They stressed that how frantically the U.S. and the West may kick up the human rights rackets against the DPRK, the Korean people are dynamically advancing along the road of socialism.

articles.title: Website of African Regional Committee for Study of Juche Idea Opens
articles.content:
Website of African Regional Committee for Study of Juche Idea Opens
Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Website of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea was opened with due ceremony in Uganda on Oct. 14.
					 The website depicts the torch of the Tower of the Juche Idea and African continent with an article titled "Man Is Master of His Destiny."
					
					 Present at the ceremony were personages of the committee, the office of the prime minister of Uganda and the Uganda National Resistance Movement and members of the Juche idea study organizations and organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre hospicio y orfanato de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre hospicio y orfanato de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 26 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio el hospicio y orfanato de Pyongyang, recien terminados.
					El fue acogido en el terreno por el teniente general de las fuerzas terrestres Ma Won Chun, director de diseno del CDN, Ro Kyong Jun, Kim Jin Gun y otros comandantes de unidad de construccion y por los funcionarios del hospicio y orfanato.
					
					Estos dos planteles cuentan con mas de 250 salas, entre otras, la de crianza, la de educacion, la de ejercicios, la de juegos intelectuales, la de asistencia medica, etc., instalaciones y muebles necesarios a la vida de los huerfanos, piscinas al aire libre y bajo techo, parques, diversas instalaciones de recreo y equipos de juegos.
					
					Contemplando con amplia sonrisa un panorama de hospicio y orfanato, el Mariscal se mostro muy satisfecho diciendo que son de veras vistosos, elegantes, magnificos y que es una obra maestra de la epoca del Songun.
					
					Hizo detallado conocimiento de estado de culminacion recorriendo varios lugares.
					
					Refiriendose a que todos los elementos son perfectos para ambiente de vida y adecuados a la ensenanza y educacion, destaco que es importante haber acondicionado tales instalaciones, pero, lo mas importante es criar bien a los huerfanos y dio preciosas instrucciones que se presentan para elevar la responsabilidad y el papel de criadoras y educadoras.
					
					El Mariscal evaluo a los militares constructores que los edificaron magnificamente conforme al proposito del partido como los integrantes de la unidad de educadores constructores del pais y volvio a dar el agradecimiento del Comandante Supremo del EPC a la citada Unidad 267 del EPC que levanto tambien este ano numerosas creaciones monumentales que glorifican la gran era dorada de construccion de la epoca del Songun.
					
					Le acompanaron los secretarios del CC del PTC Choe Ryong Hae y Kim Ki Nam, el jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Han Kwang Sang y el primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Jae Il.
